abstract: The highest court in California ruled Monday that Bank of America need not pay a potential $1 billion in compensation to customers who claimed the bank illegally raided Social Security benefits to collect fees, Reuters said.
snippet: The highest court in California ruled Monday that Bank of America need not pay a potential $1 billion in compensation to customers who claimed the bank illegally raided Social Security benefits to collect fees, Reuters said.
lead_paragraph: The highest court in California ruled Monday that Bank of America need not pay a potential $1 billion in compensation to customers who claimed the bank illegally raided Social Security benefits to collect fees, Reuters said.

headline.main: Bank of America Wins $1 Billion Suit in California
